channel.title: One of those days
channel.description: Recent content on One of those days

item.title: About Me
item.description: Every-day life developer experience and over 10 years in home-and-friend-IT-free support, for life :’). Nevertheless, I valued the chance given to me and the experience that gained over the years. It has shaped to what I am today, to that I’m deeply grateful. Started from LAMP stack without framework, it was a good experience and steep learning curve without a proper mentor. Found and invest my time into Laravel, then some touching on .NET Core (now known as .NET). I Learn the eco-system in programming softwares, Object-Oriented, Functional which just an abstraction from the true software-practices imagination and procedural. Corrected myself from version-control using copy-paste folders instead of investing time to learn SVN, and GIT

item.title: How Linux handles file permission
item.description: Linux (also known as GNU/Linux) is a clone of UNIX, the multi-user operating system which can be accessed by many users simultaneously. Linux can also be used in mainframes and servers without any modifications (and this attracts attackers). But this raises security concerns as an unsolicited or malign user can corrupt, change or remove crucial data. Ownership Permission Linux (also known as GNU/Linux) is a clone of UNIX, the multi-user operating system which can be accessed by many users simultaneously. Linux can also be used in mainframes and servers without any modifications (and this attracts attackers). But this raises security concerns as an unsolicited or malign user can corrupt, change or remove crucial data.
